sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"年轻的，年幼的"之意。
means: young ： 强调年龄小，处于生长的前期。
youthful ： 褒义或贬义均可用。指具有青年人的外貌或年轻人应具有的品格。
juvenile ： 较正式用词，一般12岁以下的少年，着重其生理和智力上的不成熟。
adolescent ： 指13至16岁左右处于青春期的人，尚不成熟。

sentence.Network_en: A young man plunged from a sheer rock face to his death.
sentence.Network_cn: 一名男青年从陡峭的岩壁上坠崖身亡。

sentence.Network_en: Traditionally young Asians in Britain have gravitated towards medicine, law and engineering.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国的亚裔年轻人通常被吸引到医学、法律及工程专业。

sentence.Network_en: I remember being very young and being totally enamored of him.
sentence.Network_cn: 我记得当时很年轻，非常迷恋他。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English g(e)ong, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch jong and German jung, also to youth; from an Indo-European root shared by Latin juvenis

entry.tran: 年幼的;幼小的;未成熟的
entry.def: A young person, animal, or plant has not lived or existed for very long and is not yet mature.

example.ex: In Scotland, young people can marry at 16...
example.tran: 在苏格兰，年轻人16岁就可以结婚。

example.ex: You weren't so very young when she died; you were old enough to remember.
example.tran: 她去世的时候你不算太年幼，已经能记事了。

entry.def: You use young to describe  a time when a person or thing was young.

example.ex: In her younger days my mother had been a successful fashionwear saleswoman.
example.tran: 我妈妈年轻时曾经是个成功的时装销售员。

entry.tran: （显得）年轻的;（显得）岁数不大的
entry.def: Someone who is young in appearance or behaviour looks or behaves as if they are young.

example.ex: I was twenty-three, I suppose, and young for my age...
example.tran: 我当时23岁，我想，看上去比实际年龄小。

example.ex: He seemed to me very young and very lonely.
example.tran: 我觉得他似乎非常年轻，非常孤独。

entry.def: The young of an animal are its babies.

example.ex: The hen may not be able to feed its young.
example.tran: 雌鸟可能无法给幼鸟喂食。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of living things especially persons) in an early period of life or development or growth;
2. (of crops) harvested at an early stage of development; before complete maturity;

example.en: We keep young bloods so busy they never have a chance to look out of the window.
example.zh: 我们让新来的年轻人不停地工作，忙得他们都没空往窗外看闲眼。

auth_sentence.res_content: Welby's parents divorced when he was very young.

auth_sentence.res_content: But young people now have more choices in life.

stems_affixes.word_buile: young年轻→adj.年轻的, 年纪小的
young年轻+ster人→n.年青人, 少年

Sentence.sentence: The question of whether our government should promote science and technology or the liberal arts in higher education isn't an either/or proposition(命题),although the current emphasis on preparing young Americans for STEM（science, technology, engineering, maths）-related fields can make it seem that way.

The Big Three American carmakers—General Motors, Ford and Chrysler—accumulated ruinous costs over the post-war years, such as gold-plated health plans and pensions for workers who retired as young as 48.
young Americans say reading is important, more important than computers and science.

means.word_mean: 年幼的, 年轻的, 幼小的, 新发展的; 有朝气的, 有青春活力的

sentences.en: The young man graduated from a prestigious university.
sentences.cn: 这个年轻人毕业于一所名牌大学。

sentences.en: He has a young family to support.
The young trees have struck root.
In her young age Miss Ross did her best as a school teacher.
sentences.cn: 在她的青年时代, 罗斯小姐尽到了身为一位教师的最大本分。

sentences.en: The young look is in fashion this year.
sentences.cn: 今年时兴扮年轻人的样子。
他有着年轻人一般的雄心。

sentences.en: She is ten years younger than her husband.
He is old in body but young in heart.
That hat is too young for you.
sentences.cn: 你戴那顶帽子显得太年轻了。

sentences.en: You are too young to join the army.
sentences.cn: 你年龄太小, 还不能参军。

sentences.en: The young in our society need care and protection.
sentences.cn: 我们社会的年轻人需要关怀和照顾。

sentences.en: The lion fought to protect her young.
sentences.cn: 那头狮子为了保护其幼狮而进行搏斗。

sentences.en: The cat has been with young.

jushi.english: The young look is in fashion this year.
jushi.chinese: 今年时兴扮年轻人的样子。

jushi.english: The young seedlings grow very rapidly.
He is the youngest boy in our class.
jushi.chinese: 他是我们班年龄最小的男同学。
